subject: [junit] java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Test class can only have one constructor
msgSnippet: Hi- The following is my Test class import org.junit.Test; public class Test2 { public Test2() { System.out.println( Inside zero arg con ); } public
messageBody:
Hi-

The following is my Test class

import org.junit.Test;
public class Test2 {

public Test2()
{
System.out.println("Inside zero arg con");
}

public Test2(String arg)
{
System.out.println("Inside arg con");
}
@Test
public void m1()
{
System.out.println("inside method m1()");
}
@Test
public void m2()
{
System.out.println("inside method m2()");
}
}

when i run it ..an exception is thrown...

JUnit version 4.5
.E

There was 1 failure:

FAILURES!!!
Tests run: 1, Failures: 1

The question is,

1. Can a junit not have more than one public construtor

2. or is there any other reason for this failure

Thanks
sharath
